trigger: The DNA - binding properties of two heat shock factors , <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , are induced in the avian erythroblast cell line HD6 .

Avian cells express three heat shock transcription factor ( HSF ) genes corresponding to a novel factor , <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and homologs of mouse and human <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> HSF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Analysis of the biochemical and cell biological properties of these HSFs reveals that <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has properties in common with both <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> HSF2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and yet has features which are distinct from both .

<extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is constitutively expressed in the erythroblast cell line HD6 , the lymphoblast cell line MSB , and embryo fibroblasts , and yet its DNA - binding activity is induced only upon exposure of HD6 cells to heat shock .

Acquisition of <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA - binding activity in HD6 cells is accompanied by oligomerization from a non-DNA - binding dimer to a DNA - binding trimer , whereas the effect of heat shock on <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is oligomerization of an inert monomer to a DNA - binding trimer .
Induction of <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> DNA - binding activity is delayed compared with that of <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
As occurs for <extra_id_0> HSF1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , heat shock leads to the translocation of <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> to the nucleus .

HSF exhibits the properties of a transcriptional activator , as judged from the stimulatory activity of transiently overexpressed <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> measured by using a heat shock element - containing reporter construct and as independently assayed by the activity of a chimeric <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> protein on a <extra_id_0> GAL4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> reporter construct .
These results reveal that <extra_id_0> HSF3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is negatively regulated in avian cells and acquires DNA - binding activity in certain cells upon heat shock .
